required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Aripiprazole and Effexor XR Drug Interaction Study
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Aripiprazole on the Steady-State Pharmacokinetics of Venlafaxine in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical research study is to learn whether aripiprazole has effect on the steady-state pharmacokinetics of venlafaxine in healthy subjects. The safety and tolerability of aripiprazole and venlafaxine co-administration will also be studied.

primary_outcome.measure: Multiple dose PK parameters for venlafaxine+metabolite when administered alone and with aripiprazole will be derived. Cmin for aripiprazole,dehydro-aripiprazole will be measured

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety will be based on review of AEs, VS, ECGs, physical exam, clinical labs

intervention.intervention_name: Venlafaxine on Day -4 to day 14, Aripiprazole dosed starting on Day 1: 3 days at 10 mg, 4 days at 1 mg and 7 days at 20 mg.
intervention.description: Tablets, Oral, Venlafaxine: 75 mg; Aripiprazole: 10, 15, 20 mg once daily, 14 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male and female subjects, ages 18 to 45 (WOCBP) must be using an adequate method of contraception to avoid pregnancy throughout the study and for up to 4 weeks after the study in such a manner that the risk of pregnancy is minimized.
- Body Mass Index (BMI) of 18 to 33 kg/m2, inclusive.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with a decrease in SBP of >=20 mm Hg and increase in HR of >=20 bpm after 2 minutes standing vs. 2 minutes supine at screening or with frank orthostatic hypotension at screening.
- Supine BP of 90/50 mm Hg or lower at screening
- SBP >=140 mm Hg or DBP >=90 mm Hg at screening

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm
